content.description: Prominent dihedral right of Gill Rakers. Start in the dark crack feature and get established into the main crack lending  some smaller holds.  A little balance and finesse will see you to the top.
content.location: Prominent dihedral right of Gill Rakers.

content.description: Look for a small vertical crack feature just to the left of an orange stain in the middle of the boulder.  Find the start holds just above the ramp and begin to work feet up the small ramp to get established in the first crack seem.  Go up to the next diagonal crack seem and keep moving left.  Tops out just to the right of ‘Spiracle’
content.location: Look for a small vertical crack feature just to the left of an orange stain in the middle of the boulder.

content.description: Start just to the right of ‘Myomeres’ on prominent jug holds and feet on the dark ramp.  Begin to move up and left as to finish ‘Myomeres’.
content.location: Start just to the right of ‘Myomeres’ on prominent jug holds

content.description: On the far left side of the Shark Fin Boulder start on the solid rock within the gnarly formations, bends, and ripples.  Follow straight up finding good holds within the large protrusions.  Top out straight above to avoid finishing within the dihedral of spiracle.
content.location: On the far left side of the Shark Fin Boulder start on the solid rock within the gnarley formations, bends, and ripples.

content.description:
Classic.

 Stand start under the sharp, overhung arete (far right of the boulder) on good holds. Work up the face to find the deep pocket along the belly of the sharp arete and span out to the far sloper arete of the boulder. Compress and follow the edges of the boulder. Continue to top out.
content.location: The far right side and sharp arete of the Shark Fin Boulder

content.description: As the name suggests, the stand out feature here is the wild sharp arete on the boulders side.
